info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 18 at 8:03PM EDT until August 19 at 12:45AM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast South Carolina, including the following counties, Beaufort and Jasper. * WHEN...Until 1100 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 757 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - An area of torrential rainfall is impacting portions of Beaufort and Jasper counties, primarily around Beaufort, Burton, Laurel Bay, and surrounding locations. Radar data estimates that 2 to 4 inches of rain has fallen since approximately 5:30 pm. This is supported by a few rain gauge observations around Ridgeland indicating 3 to 4 inches fell in 2 to 3 hours. The heaviest rain is now spreading into the downtown Beaufort and minor flooding can be expected around the area. Area roadways could become flooded due to deep ponding of water, making travel hazardous. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches will be possible through the late evening hours. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Beaufort, Port Royal, Ridgeland, Clarendon, Laurel Bay, Beaufort Marine Corps Air Station, Burton, Shell Point, Dale, Lemon Island, Ladys Island, Old House, Parris Island, Grahamville, Chesterfield, Grays Hill, Lobeco, Beaufort Memorial Hospital, Edwards Burton Rodgers Bridge and Walling Grove.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Report flooding directly to the Charleston National Weather Service at 1-888-383-2024 or email your reports to nws.charlestonsc@noaa.gov.
